citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
Three long-haired adult cats have areas of matted hair.
Scarlett (#6), an orange female exotic short hair cat has several matted hair clumps (about 1 inch in size) around her tail
base and under it. There are clumps of dried feces on the underside of the tail and her perianal region.
Amanda, (#9) a seal point Persian female cat has matter hair clumps around her neck and throat. There are numerous
small clumps about 1 inch in size.
Steve (#1), a male seal point Persian cat has a large clump of matted hair on the right side of his neck. There is a patch of
hair missing next to this clump with an abrasion about 1 inch long that is scabbed over. There are also 1 inch clumps of
matted hair along his sides and perianal region.
Matted hair can pull at the skin and cause discomfort to the animals. It can obscure skin conditions that can go untreated
and worsen if not observed and properly treated.
The licensee must have a plan for the use of appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and
injuries, The matted hair must be removed and a program of regular grooming begun to prevent the hair coats from
becoming matted. The veterinarian should be consulted for proper care if any skin conditions are observed.
Correction date: from this day forward.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n
